snippet: A Palestinian fertility doctor said he is helping 50 women to become pregnant by smuggling their husbands’ sperm out of Israeli prisons.
abstract: Palestinian fertility doctor Salem Abu Khaizaran says he is helping about 50 women conceive children using sperm smuggled out of Israeli prisons, that four of the women are pregnant after in vitro fertilization, and that one delivered boy; some authorities have cast doubt on Khaizaran's claims, questioning whether sperm could survive trek to and from prisons.

byline.original: By KHALED ABU AKER and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Fares Akram contributed reporting from Gaza City.

lead_paragraph: A Palestinian fertility doctor said he is helping 50 women to become pregnant by smuggling their husbands’ sperm out of Israeli prisons.

headline.seo: Palestinian Describes Plan to Smuggle Sperm From Jails
headline.main: An Unlikely Path to Palestinian Fatherhood
headline.print_headline: An Unlikely Path to Palestinian Fatherhood
